title: Treasuries Slide, Stocks Drop After US Downgrade: Markets Wrap
content: US equity-index futures dropped and Treasuries’ yield curve steepened after Moody’s Ratings stripped the US government of its top credit rating, citing a ballooning budget deficit it said showed little sign of narrowing.

title: EU and UK Negotiators Agree Terms of Starmer’s Post-Brexit Reset
content: Negotiators for the European Union and the UK have reached a deal to strengthen their post-Brexit relationship ahead of a summit on Monday, according to people familiar with the discussions and documents seen by Bloomberg.

title: Mizuho Sees 10-Year Treasuries at 5% by Yearend
content: Jordan Rochester, fixed income strategist at Mizuho, discusses the outlook for Treasuries after a debt downgrade by Moody’s Ratings increased concerns over US debt. “I’m of the view that the recession fears were overblown,” Rochester says on Bloomberg Television. “We’ve seen Donald Trump has really rowed his tariffs back, and there’s potential for more to come.”

title: France Touts Record Foreign Investment at Macron’s Annual Summit
content: French President Emmanuel Macron will tally €37 billion ($41.4 billion) in foreign investment at an annual gathering with business leaders, seeking to send an upbeat message as the slow-growing economy faces headwinds from US trade tariffs.

title: Thailand, Indonesia Pledge to Boost Trade as Strategic Partners
content: Thailand and Indonesia pledged to boost trade and investment and cooperate on cyber scam and drug trafficking crackdowns, as Southeast Asia’s two biggest economies elevated ties to a strategic partnership.

title: QEF To Open in Doha; Israel Steps Up Gaza Offensive | Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/19/2025
content: The 5th edition of the Qatar Economic Forum is opening in Doha under the theme "The Road to 2030: Transforming the Global Economy". Also on the show: South African President, Cyril Ramaphosa, is set to meet with US President Donald Trump on Wednesday; the UK has announced plans to permanently scrap visas for care workers; Israeli officials say they're poised to order tanks and troops into unconquered parts of Gaza; Bloomberg has learned Russian President Vladimir Putin believes he has a strong hand ahead of a phone call with President Trump; Nvidia CEO, Jensen Huang, has kicked off Computex in Taiwan. Guests include: Parisha Saimbi, BNP Paribas, FXLM Strategist; Neil Quilliam, Chatham House, Associate Fellow at the Middle East & North Africa Programme. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: BNP Paribas: Global Clients Looking to Diversify As Uncertainty Persists
content:
Brian McCappin, APAC Deputy Head of Global Markets at BNP Paribas, expects investors to look through Moody's downgrade of the US credit rating. He says clients are actively looking for opportunities to diversify their holdings. He joined "Bloomberg: Insight with Haslinda Amin" from the sidelines of the BNP Paribas Global Electric Vehicle & Mobility Conference. 
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Sell America’ Is Back as Moody’s Pushes 30-Year Yield to 5%
content: Longer-dated Treasury yields rose to the psychological 5% level and S&P 500 Index futures slid with the dollar after a downgrade of the US’s credit score by Moody’s Ratings increased concerns over the nation’s debt.

title: Romania’s Leu Leads Gains in Emerging Market FX on Vote Result
content: Romania’s leu rallied the most among emerging market currencies on Monday, helped by news of the centrist candidate’s election victory in Bucharest.

title: Nvidia Expands Partnerships For Its AI Tech
content: Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang on Monday kicked off Computex in Taiwan, Asia’s biggest electronics forum, touting new products and cementing ties with a region vital to the tech supply chain. Among the announcements, Nvidia said more ocmpanies will build its DGX Spark product, which the company touts as a desktop sized supercomputer.

title: Oil Edges Lower With Ukraine War Talks, US Outlook in Focus
content: Oil edged lower, with talks to end the war in Ukraine and a lowering of the US credit rating in focus.

title: Hedge Funds Reload Long Yen Trades Ahead of G-7 Meeting
content: Hedge funds and long-term investors are re-entering trades looking for the yen to rally ahead of potential currency talks this week between the US and Japan.

title: Dubai Holding Ups Reit IPO Size to as Much as $584 Million
content: Dubai Holding boosted the size of the initial public offering of its residential real estate investment trust, seeking to raise as much as $584 million amid strong demand from domestic and international investors.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks to Fall, Pound Holds at $1.33
Leapmotor Working with Stellantis on Local Production
content: Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology, says the Chinese electric vehicle maker may tap facilities owned by its partner Stellantis to expand production in Europe. Leapmotor Co-President Michael Wu spoke exclusively with David Ingles on "Bloomberg: The China Show" in an exclusive interview from the sidelines of the BNP Paribas Global Electric Vehicle & Mobility Conference. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China's Ehang Mulls Listing Outside of US
content: The Nasdaq-listed Chinese producer of electric aircraft Ehang is "actively exploring different alternatives" for a secondary listing outside of the US. CFO Conor Yang discussed the company's international expansion plans with David Ingles and Yvonne Man on "Bloomberg: The China Show" from the sidelines of the BNP Paribas Global Electric Vehicle & Mobility Conference. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/19/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: France Asks Airlines to Cut 15% of Paris-Orly Flights Monday
content: France’s civil aviation regulator asked airlines to cut 15% of flights at Paris-Orly airport on Monday as authorities continue to repair air traffic control systems.

title: Nvidia CEO Unveils New Tech at Taiwan's Computex
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang unveiled the latest raft of technologies aimed at sustaining the boom in demand for AI computing — and ensuring that its products stay at the center of the action. One of the announcements at Taiwan's Computex was the NVLink Fusion. NVLink Fusion products will allow customers the option to either use their own central processor units with Nvidia’s AI chips or use Nvidia’s CPUs with another provider’s AI accelerators. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Indian Defense Stocks Extend Rally on Earnings Boost, Spending
content: Defense stocks in India are stretching their rally after a record surge last week, powered by strong earnings and signs of increased spending in the sector.

title: BNP Paribas Says It’s Launching €1.08 Billion Share Buyback
content: BNP Paribas SA has launched the share buyback planned for 2025, worth €1.08 billion ($1.2 billion), it said in a statement on Monday.

title: Gold Pares Gains After Getting Boost From Moody’s US Downgrade
content: Gold edged higher — although it pared gains from earlier in the session - as mounting concerns over the US economic outlook and budget deficit buoyed demand for haven assets.

title: Moody’s Blues Come for US Sentiment
content: It would be a mistake to be complacent about this downgrade.

title: Sasol Investors Seek Clarity at First Strategy Update Since 2021
content: Sasol Ltd. will hold its first Capital Markets Day since 2021 next week and investors will seek details on plans to lower emissions that dovetail with the production outlook for the world’s biggest producer of fuel and chemicals from coal.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  5/19/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Goldman Leads in a Patchy Year for Foreign Banks in Japan
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. was among major global banks to post lower profit in Japan last year, pulling back from a bumper 2023.

title: China’s Home Prices Drop at Faster Pace During Tariff War
content: China’s home prices fell at a faster pace in April, signaling the property market slump remains a headache for policymakers as they fend off trade tensions with the US.

title: Maybank Facilitates $545 Million Investments Into Economic Zone
content: Malaysia’s largest lender Malayan Banking Bhd. facilitated as much as 2.35 billion ringgit ($545 million) in client investments into the Johor-Singapore Special Economic Zone as part of efforts to promote the region.

title: Taiwan Seeks LNG Cargoes After Shutting Last Nuclear Reactor
content: Taiwan is seeking liquefied natural gas shipments following the shutdown of its last nuclear reactor, a move that will increase the island’s reliance on the seaborne fuel.

title: The UK Is Taxing an Oil Windfall That Doesn’t Exist
content: Let common sense prevail in the government about the North Sea.

title: EU and UK Negotiators Agree Terms of Starmer’s Post-Brexit Reset
content: Negotiators for the European Union and the UK have reached a deal to strengthen their post-Brexit relationship ahead of a summit on Monday, according to people familiar with the discussions and documents seen by Bloomberg.

title: France Touts Record Foreign Investment at Macron’s Annual Summit
content: French President Emmanuel Macron will tally €37 billion ($41.4 billion) in foreign investment at an annual gathering with business leaders, seeking to send an upbeat message as the slow-growing economy faces headwinds from US trade tariffs.

title: Thailand Unveils Measures to Shield Firms From Trade War Fallout
content: Thailand will offer bigger tax incentives to small and medium businesses at risk of being squeezed by US tariff threats, as the Southeast Asian nation unveiled a raft of measures to minimize the blow to its economy from the trade war.

title: Thailand, Indonesia Pledge to Boost Trade as Strategic Partners
content: Thailand and Indonesia pledged to boost trade and investment and cooperate on cyber scam and drug trafficking crackdowns, as Southeast Asia’s two biggest economies elevated ties to a strategic partnership.

title: Romanian Centrist Beats Far-Right and Tusk Ally Wins in Poland
content: The centrist mayor of Bucharest won Romania’s presidential runoff on Sunday, quashing the ambitions of a far-right Donald Trump loyalist as voters backed pro-European Union politicians in three crucial elections across the bloc.

title: France Asks Airlines to Cut 15% of Paris-Orly Flights Monday
content: France’s civil aviation regulator asked airlines to cut 15% of flights at Paris-Orly airport on Monday as authorities continue to repair air traffic control systems.

title: Ishiba Rebuffs Tax Cut Demands With Greek Debt Comparison
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba rebuffed calls for tax cuts saying that the nation’s financial conditions are worse than Greece’s.

title: Trump Tax Bill Advances After GOP Deal for Faster Medicaid Cuts
content: A key House committee advanced President Donald Trump’s giant tax and spending package after Republican hardliners won agreement from party leaders to speed up cuts to Medicaid health coverage.

title: Mini ‘Sell America’ Trade Revived After Moody’s Downgrades US
content: Investors faced yet another bumpy start to the trading week with US assets coming under fresh pressure, although it’s mounting concern over American debt rather than tariffs generating the volatility this time.

title: Japan’s Ishiba Says Won’t Fixate on US Trade Talk Time Limits
content: Japan won’t compromise its national interests in trade talks with the US by fixating on time limits, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said, signaling Tokyo isn’t rushing into an agreement.

title: Authorities Identify Suspect in Palm Springs Fertility Clinic Explosion
content: A 25-year-old man the FBI believes was responsible for an explosion that ripped through a Southern California fertility clinic left behind “anti-pro-life” writings before carrying out an attack investigators called terrorism, authorities said Sunday.

title: China Tells Officials to Rein In Alcohol, Cigarette Spending
content: China reminded officials around the country to cut wasteful spending on travel, food and office space, adding to signs of an austerity push by President Xi Jinping as economic headwinds strain government budgets.

title: Japan PM Ishiba’s Support Falls, No Ouster Seen Before July
content: Support for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s government weakened, according to public opinion surveys published by major Japanese news organizations over the weekend, although it remains unlikely he’ll be ousted before a national election in July.

title: Polish Ballot Set to Jolt Zloty as Pro-EU Front-Runner Pressured
content: A stronger-than-expected showing by opposition populists in the first round of Poland’s presidential election will test investor appetite for the country’s assets.

title: China-US Trade Truce Prompts Nations to Consider Tougher Tactics
content: China’s defiant stance in negotiating a tariff truce with the US has convinced some countries they need to take a tougher position in their own trade talks with the Trump administration.

title: South Korean Election Favorite Sees No Need to Rush for US Deal
content: South Korea’s leading presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung said there’s no need to rush into an early agreement in trade negotiations with the US, criticizing the interim government for what he called its hasty engagement with the Trump administration.

title: Milei Wins Big in Buenos Aires City Vote, Dethroning Macri
content: Javier Milei struck at the heart of his former ally’s biggest bastion of support and came out victorious in the city of Buenos Aires, cementing his hold on Argentina’s political right months before pivotal midterm elections.

title: China Gave Pakistan Satellite Support, Indian Defense Group Says
content: China provided Pakistan with air defense and satellite support during its clash with India this month, according to a research group under India’s Ministry of Defence, suggesting that Beijing was more directly involved in the conflict than was previously disclosed.

title: Portugal’s Center Right Wins Vote But Falls Short of Majority
content: Portugal’s ruling center-right coalition won a snap election Sunday in a vote that saw the far-right and the Socialists compete neck-and-neck for second place, rocking the two-party system that’s dominated the country’s political life for 50 years.

title: Warsaw Mayor to Face Populist in Polish Presidential Runoff
content: The mayor of Warsaw was poised for a narrow win over a pro-Donald Trump nationalist in the first round of Poland’s presidential election that is critical for the pro-European government’s agenda to undo years of populist rule.

title: Putin Heads Into Trump Call Confident That Russia Has Upper Hand
content: Vladimir Putin believes he has a strong hand ahead of a phone call Monday with Donald Trump and European leaders are trying to prevent the US president from rushing through a deal.

title: Biden Is Diagnosed With ‘Aggressive’ Form of Prostate Cancer
content: Former US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer, his office announced.

title: Israeli Strikes Across Gaza Kill at Least 103 People, Medics Say
content: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel announced Sunday it will allow a limited amount of humanitarian aid into Gaza after a nearly three-month blockade, days after global experts on food security warned of famine.

title: UK and EU Inch Toward Accord to Help Improve Ties After Brexit
content: UK and European Union negotiators worked into Sunday evening in a bid to reset post-Brexit relations under Keir Starmer’s new Labour government ahead of a summit in London.

title: Clock Ticks on Hostage Talks as Israel Gears Up Gaza Sweep
content: Israeli officials say they’re poised to order tanks and troops into unconquered parts of the Gaza Strip in an all-out bid to destroy Hamas, throwing an ultimatum at the Palestinian Islamist faction to concede on terms for a negotiated winding down of the war.

title: Portugal’s Premier Wins Election, Misses Majority: Exit Polls
content: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s center-right coalition won a snap election on Sunday, gaining a few more seats in parliament but still falling short of an absolute majority, exit polls showed.

title: Biden Diagnosed With Aggressive Prostate Cancer, NYT Reports
content: Former US President Joe Biden was diagnosed last week with an aggressive form of prostate cancer, the New York Times reported Sunday, citing a spokesperson.

title: Hungarians Protest Orban Plans to Crush Civil Society, Media
content: Hungarians demonstrated in Budapest against Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s escalating campaign to muzzle critics less than a year before elections.

title: Houthis Say They Plan to Target Israeli Airports in Coming Hours
content: Yemen’s Houthi rebels announced that they would carry out in the coming few hours military operations targeting Ben Gurion and other airports in Israel, in response to the Israeli escalation in Gaza.

title: Meloni to See Vance, Von Der Leyen as Leaders Gather in Rome
content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni hailed a “new beginning” in transatlantic relations as she hosted US Vice President JD Vance and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen to talk about trade, tariffs and security.

title: UK, EU Leaders Meet in First Formal Summit Since Brexit
content: Negotiators from the UK and the European Union worked into Sunday night in a bid to reset post-Brexit relations ahead of a summit in London. According to people familiar with the matter, the UK and the EU reached a deal to strengthen their bilateral relationship. Bloomberg’s Lizzy Burden reports from Lancaster House.

title: Ryanair CEO on Earnings, Tariffs, Buybacks, Boeing
content: Ryanair Holdings Plc Chief Executive Officer Michael O’Leary discusses the company’s performance as the airline said growth this year will depend on working through the risk of tariff wars, geopolitical conflicts and macro-economic blows. O’Leary also talks about Boeing deliveries, oil prices, and Ryanair’s buyback plans. He speaks to Bloomberg’s Tom Mackenzie.

title: Ramaphosa Set to Meet Trump in Washington
content: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa will meet his US counterpart Donald Trump on May 21 after months of criticism from the US president, but some advisers fear he risks a Volodymyr Zelenskiy-style dressing down in the Oval Office. Bloomberg’s Jennifer Zabasajja reports.

title: Israel Poised to Step Up Gaza Offensive
content: Israeli officials say they’re poised to order tanks and troops into unconquered parts of the Gaza Strip in an all-out bid to destroy Hamas, throwing an ultimatum at the Palestinian Islamist faction to concede on terms for a negotiated winding down of the war. Israel said however it would shortly begin to “admit a basic amount of food for the population in order to ensure that a famine crisis does not unfold” after a full block of food and other aid into Gaza that began on March 2. content: Vodacom Group Ltd., Africa’s largest wireless carrier, declared a full-year dividend that beat analysts’ estimates as headline earnings increased slightly.

title: Alibaba Shares Slide as AI Deal With Apple Faces US Scrutiny
content: Shares of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. slumped after a report that the Trump administration has raised concerns over Apple Inc.’s potential deal with the Chinese technology firm.

title: Richest Thai Man Raises Top Bank’s Stake to Be No. 3 Shareholder
content: Gulf Development Pcl, controlled by Thailand’s richest man Sarath Ratanavadi, has raised its stake in Kasikornbank Pcl to about $610 million, making it the commercial lender’s third-largest shareholder.

title: Baidu, Bilibili, Lenovo Report as US-China Trade Tensions Ease
content: Baidu Inc., Bilibili Inc. and Lenovo Group Ltd. are among the Chinese tech firms in focus for this week’s earnings, just as the easing US-China trade war brings back some optimism for the sector.

title: Chinese Luxury Carmaker Seres Comes From Behind to Overtake BMW
content: In under four years, Seres Group Co., a small Chinese automaker once best known for its 30,000 yuan ($4,200) minivans, has beaten luxury legacy names like BMW and Mercedes to become the nation’s hottest high-end car seller.

title: Cybersecurity Firm Cyera Valued at $6 Billion in Funding Round

content: Insiders say continued failure to get artificial intelligence right threatens everything from the iPhone’s dominance to plans for robots and other futuristic products.

title: Crypto High-Rollers Go Big on Bodyguards to Deter Kidnappers
content: Even before Coinbase Global Inc. disclosed that hackers had stolen the home addresses and account balances of its customers, Jethro Pijlman was seeing an uptick in interest from concerned clients with large crypto holdings who were looking for bodyguards and other forms of protection.

title: Beyond Nvidia, Four Things to Know at Asia’s Biggest Tech Show
content: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang headlines the 2025 edition of Asia’s biggest electronics conference, for years a showcase for his company’s cutting-edge AI chips and the companies lining up to buy them. This year, however, the spotlight may well be on another far bigger personality: US President Donald Trump.

title: Nvidia CEO Sees No Evidence of AI Chip Diversion Into China
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang expressed confidence in his company’s trade partners and said there’s no evidence of its prized semiconductors being diverted to the Chinese market.

title: OpenAI, Oracle to Help UAE Develop Massive Data Center
content: OpenAI plans to help develop a massive new data center in the United Arab Emirates that may eventually be one of the largest in the world, a major bet on the Middle East and a significant expansion of the company’s global AI infrastructure ambitions.

title: EU and UK Negotiators Agree Terms of Starmer’s Post-Brexit Reset

content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba rebuffed calls for tax cuts saying that the nation’s financial conditions are worse than Greece’s.

title: Thailand Slashes Growth Forecast on Impact of Trade War
content: Thailand significantly lowered its forecast for economic growth this year as the global trade war undercuts private investment and exports, adding to already-weak consumption at home.

title: Rafizi Says Johor-Singapore Zone to Remain Even if He’s Replaced
content: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said the Johor-Singapore Special Economic Zone will remain a government priority as he sought to assure investors of the longevity of the program.

title: China Consumption Miss Overshadows Factory Strength Amid Tariffs
content: China’s industrial output expanded faster than expected in April while consumption disappointed, highlighting the challenges facing the world’s second-largest economy despite a quick de-escalation of trade tensions with the US.

title: Japan’s Ishiba Says Won’t Fixate on US Trade Talk Time Limits
content: Japan won’t compromise its national interests in trade talks with the US by fixating on time limits, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said, signaling Tokyo isn’t rushing into an agreement.

title: Japan PM Ishiba’s Support Falls, No Ouster Seen Before July
content: Support for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s government weakened, according to public opinion surveys published by major Japanese news organizations over the weekend, although it remains unlikely he’ll be ousted before a national election in July.

title: China-US Trade Truce Prompts Nations to Consider Tougher Tactics
content: China’s defiant stance in negotiating a tariff truce with the US has convinced some countries they need to take a tougher position in their own trade talks with the Trump administration.

title: Australia’s Productivity at 60-Year Low as Reforms Selected
content: Australia’s Productivity Commission has identified 15 priority reforms to examine in the course of five inquiries it’s conducting for the government to try to boost economic efficiency and raise living standards.

title: UK Home Asking Prices Rise to Record High as Demand Rebounds
content: Asking prices for UK homes rose to a new record high in May and demand picked up in a sign of the property market’s resilience after the end of a tax cut for buyers.

title: Midpoint of Trump Tariff Hiatus to Reveal Increasingly Unsettled World
content: Reports in the coming week may give the fullest reading to date of how major economies are faring with trade disruptions, halfway through President Donald Trump’s 90-day hiatus on so-called reciprocal tariffs.

title: Australia Set for Another Rate Cut as US-China Tensions Ease
content: Australia’s central bank is set to lower interest rates for a second time this year as price pressures ease and US-China trade tensions take a pause, though lingering risks around both suggest the board will remain cautious on the policy path ahead.

title: US States Likely to Defy US Downgrade to Keep Top Credit Ratings
content: US states from Florida to North Carolina and Texas would likely hold onto top-notch credit scores from Moody’s Ratings, mostly because they’re in better fiscal shape than the federal government itself.

title: Israel’s Economy Grew 3.4% in 1Q, Helped by Brief Gaza Ceasefire
content: Israel’s economy picked up in the first quarter, helped by a temporary ceasefire in the Gaza Strip that ended in mid-March and has given way to a new escalation in fighting.

title: Bessent Calls Moody’s ‘Lagging Indicator’ of US Fiscal Health
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed concerns over the US’s government debt and the inflationary impact of tariffs on companies including Walmart Inc., saying the Trump administration is determined to lower federal spending and grow the economy.

title: UK, EU Wrangle Over Students and Travel Ahead of Reset Summit
content: British and European Union negotiators wrangled over measures to ease travel for students, young workers and tourists this weekend, as the two sides raced to resolve policy disputes ahead of a summit meant to reset their fraught relationship.

title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Euro’s Strength Is Counterintuitive, But Justified
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the recent rise of the euro against the dollar is a consequence of US President Donald Trump’s erratic policies and an opportunity for Europe.

title: Portugal Holds Third Election in Three Years: What to Watch
content: Portugal holds its third election in as many years on Sunday, after Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government lost a confidence vote in parliament in March.

title: India Restricts Some Imports from Bangladesh as Ties Suffer
content: India imposed curbs on imports of ready-made garments and processed food from Bangladesh, as relations between the two neighbors turned sour in recent months.

title: Canada Says Most Tariffs on US Remain, Pushing Back on Oxford Report
content: Canada’s finance minister said the government kept 25% retaliatory tariffs on tens of billions of dollars in US goods, disputing a report from a research firm that suggested it had paused the vast majority of those levies.

title: Australia ‘Up for a Deal’ With the EU After Years of Trade Talks
content: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Australia is “up for a deal” with the European Union, sounding a note of cautious optimism after years of trade negotiations.

title: US Says It’s Not Decided Next Steps on NYC’s Congestion Pricing
content: The Trump administration urged a federal judge to refrain from blocking the government from taking any action against New York’s congestion pricing program, saying it hasn’t actually done anything yet.

title: Trump’s Deals Cast China Both as Foe and Prize, Blurring Signals
content: Pick through the details of recent US trade negotiations and an outline of Donald Trump’s vision for the global economy starts to come into focus. As do its contradictions.

title: Saudi Arabia Plays Trump Card in US-China Dance
content: A 1945 meeting between President Franklin D. Roosevelt and King Abdulaziz Al Saud might be regarded as something of interest only to modern-history buffs. But this week, images of that pivotal tête-à-tête between the US and Saudi leaders circulated in news and social media as President Donald Trump visited the Middle East.

title: Charting the Global Economy: US, China Forecasts Improve on Tariff Truce
content: Economists marked up their forecasts for growth in the US and China after the world’s two-largest economies reached a temporary agreement to reduce tariffs on each other.

title: ECB’s Schnabel Says ‘Steady Hand’ Needed on Interest Rates
content: The European Central Bank should remain cautious on interest-rate moves, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.

title: UK Moves Forward With Plans to Regulate Buy-Now, Pay-Later Firms
content: The UK will introduce a series of stricter rules for buy-now, pay-later lenders from next year, a move that will bring the regulation of their offerings in line with other credit products.

title: Revolut Plans to Invest €1 Billion in France, Apply for License
content: Revolut Ltd., Europe’s largest digital bank, plans to invest more than €1 billion ($1.1 billion) in France and apply for a local banking license as the fintech eyes an expansion across Europe.

title: Diageo Plans $500 Million of Cost Cuts as US Tariffs Bite
content: Diageo Plc expects sales growth to improve in the second half of the year and set out a cost-cutting program, as the British distiller grapples with US tariffs on its shipments from the UK and Europe.

title: Ryanair Signals Strong Demand for European Summer Travel
content: Ryanair Holdings Plc signaled robust demand for travel this summer, with fares rising and Europeans sticking close to home for their holidays.

title: UK Luxury Lobby Blames Brexit for Growth Lag in EU-Bound Exports
content: UK exports of high-end items to the European Union have lagged behind the broader growth of the country’s luxury sector, a trend that industry lobby Walpole attributes to Brexit.

title: Joe Biden Has Prostate Cancer. How Serious Is the Disease?
content: Former US President Joe Biden, 82, has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones. While serious, the diagnosis highlights broader trends: Prostate cancer is among the most common cancers in men, especially as they age — but survival rates have improved over the past few decades.

title: China’s Fossil Fuels Production Retreats From Record Levels
content: Chinese fossil fuels output fell in April from the record levels hit in the prior month, although natural gas, crude oil and coal all delivered increases compared to the previous year as the government continues to prioritize security of supply despite weaker prices.

title: Top Hong Kong Builder Saw Weekend Sales Frenzy
content: Hong Kong’s biggest property developer Sun Hung Kai Properties Ltd. sold another 376 flats on Sunday after receiving more than 34,000 bids, becoming one of the most sought after projects in months thanks to low interest rates.

title: NYC Bankers Living in NJ Face Monday Chaos Even After Rail Deal
content: New Jersey commuters were left to improvise plans for Monday even after negotiators reached a deal to end a three-day strike that halted rail service to New York.

title: Hope Springs in German C-Suites as Gloom Starts to Lift
content: A vibe shift is underway in Europe’s largest economy. Plus, the CFO of India’s Tata Communications discusses growth plans, geopolitics and more.

title: NYC Bankers Who Live in NJ Game Out Commute as Rail Strike Upends RTO Plans
content: The initiative by banks and other employers in New York to bring back workers to the office is being undermined by an unexpected roadblock in a neighboring state.

title: Buffett to Skip Stage at 2026 Annual Meeting, Omaha Paper Says
content: Warren Buffett will not take the stage at the Berkshire Hathaway 2026 annual meeting, preferring instead to let his successor have the spotlight after he retires, the Omaha World-Herald reported.

title: UniCredit Asks Regulator for More Time in BPM Bid, Corriere Says
content: UniCredit SpA asked Italy’s market regulator Consob to suspend its takeover bid for Banco BPM SpA to give it time to negotiate with the government over conditions imposed on the deal, newspaper Il Corriere della Sera reported.

title: Capital One Finishes Discover Acquisition After 15-Month Journey
content: Almost 15 months after its announcement, Capital One Financial Corp.’s takeover of Discover Financial Services was officially completed on Sunday, creating the largest credit-card issuer by loan volume in the US.

title: Dubai’s Red-Hot Real Estate Is Starting to Attract Big Name Backers
content: Dubai’s real estate market - where property values have surged 70% in the last four years - is starting to entice a slew of new Wall Street investors.

title: FDA Approves Novavax Covid-19 Shot With Unusual Restrictions
content: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration has issued a long-awaited approval of Novavax’s COVID-19 vaccine but with unusual restrictions.

title: CATL Shrugs Off US Blacklisting for Blockbuster Hong Kong Debut
content: A Pentagon blacklisting, US congressional scrutiny and a global trade war haven’t been enough to stop the world’s largest maker of electric-car batteries from completing the globe’s biggest share sale so far this year.

title: Merz Sees No Risk of UniCredit Taking Over Commerzbank Currently
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz currently sees no risk that Italy’s UniCredit SpA will be able to take over Commerzbank AG.

title: Turkey Makes $30 Billion Natural Gas Discovery in the Black Sea
content: Turkey has discovered 75 billion cubic meters of natural gas worth $30 billion dollars in the Black Sea, according to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: North Macedonia Forges £5 Billion Investment Alliance With UK
content: North Macedonia is set to receive as much as £5 billion ($6.6 billion) in funding from the UK to support investment in infrastructure and other key sectors, Prime Minister Hristijan Mickoski told reporters in Skopje on Saturday.

title: Taiwan Shuts Last Nuclear Reactor as Energy Debate Heats Up
content: Taiwan started to shut its final nuclear reactor on Saturday as a 40-year operating license expired, in a move that could threaten the island’s energy security and climate goals.

title: Asian shares slide and US futures and dollar drop after Wall Street's winning week
content: Asian shares are lower after Moody's Ratings downgraded the sovereign credit rating for the United States.

title: U.S. credit rating downgrade will affect its markets
content: Absent new developments on the tariff front and confronted with new obstacles, it’s unclear if the rally in U.S. stocks last week can last.

title: Capital One completes acquisition of Discover
content: Capital One Financial services has completed its acquisition of former credit card rival Discover Financial Service, the companies announced on Sunday.

title: Scott Bessent calls Moody's a 'lagging indicator' after U.S. credit downgrade
content: The treasury secretary also said he spoke on the phone with Walmart's CEO, who agreed to absorb some of the costs of Trump's tariffs.

title: Treasure secretary calls Moody's a 'lagging indicator' after U.S. credit downgrade
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in an interview on NBC News’ “Meet the Press” that Moody’s ratings were a “lagging indicator” after the group downgraded the United States’ credit rating by a notch from the highest level.

title: TwinSpires offer code: Get $400 Bonus with exclusive sign up promo code for today's Preakness Stakes betting
content: Use the TwinSpires offer code CBSSPORTS to get an exclusive Preakness Stakes bonus of up to $400 in site credit for today's race; steps for how to claim TwinSpires promos for the Preakness.

title: Moody’s Downgrades U.S. Credit Rating Below Triple-A
content: Now all three major credit rating firms no longer give the United States their best rating.

title: Moody's downgrades U.S. credit rating, citing rising government debt
content: Moody's lowered its rating on U.S. debt from Aaa to Aa1, pointing to sustained increase in federal debt and interest payments.

title: Moody's strips U.S. government of top credit rating
content: Moody’s Ratings stripped the U.S. government of its top credit rating Friday, citing successive governments’ failure to stop a rising tide of debt.

title: The United States just lost its last perfect credit rating
content: Moody’s Ratings downgraded the United States’ debt on Friday, stripping the country of its last perfect credit rating. The move could rattle financial markets and push up interest rates, potentially creating an additional financial burden for Americans already struggling with tariffs and inflation.

content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.
